turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm having a problem with my recent bill. It seems much higher than usual, and I don't understand why.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I'm sorry to hear you're experiencing billing issues. I'd be happy to help. Could you please provide your account number so I can access your billing information?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, it's 1234567890. I just looked at the bill again, and it's showing a charge for international calls. I definitely didn't make any international calls! This is so frustrating!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for providing your account number and for bringing this to my attention. I've reviewed your account and see the international call charges. It seems the calls were made to the UK and Spain.  I'm currently investigating to determine the cause. Could you please wait a few moments?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, I can wait. But what if these charges *are* fraudulent? What's the company's policy on that, and how can I be sure this won't happen again? And...why would it say I made calls to those countries if I didn't?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: You raise some very important questions. Our policy is to investigate any potential fraudulent charges thoroughly. If we determine the calls were unauthorized, we'll credit your account for those charges. Regarding prevention, we recommend setting up a password on your account and monitoring your bill regularly.  The details surrounding the international calls are still under investigation, and I should have a more complete answer shortly, including the specific number(s) called.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that sounds reasonable. I'll wait for your investigation results and look into setting up a password. Thank you for your help so far.
